framework.utilities

Class TestHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.utilities.TestHelper

  • public class TestHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    nvonop This class is intended to be a general utility class consisting of useful methods that can be called from any location without having to instantiate an object.

    • Constructor Summary

      TestHelper()

      • getRandomString

        public static java.lang.String getRandomString()
        This method is used to obtain a string of random characters. It is useful when unique String is required for populating a form.
        Returns:
        a random String

      • getRandomString

        public static java.lang.String getRandomString(int stringLength)
        This method is used to obtain a string of random characters. It is useful when unique String is required for populating a form. The length of the string is determined by stringLength
        Parameters:
        stringLength - the length of the String that will be returned
        Returns:
        a random String

      • getScreenshot

        public static void getScreenshot()
        This method takes a screenshot and saves it in the location specified in the system property "TEST_RESULTS_PATH".

      • getScreenshot

        public static void getScreenshot(java.lang.String path)
        This method takes a screenshot and saves it in the location specified by "path".
        Parameters:
        path - the location to save the screenshot to

      • getTimestamp

        public static java.lang.String getTimestamp()
        This method calculates the timestamp at the point the method is called and returns it as a String. It is useful when you need to timestamp a file such as a screenshot.
        Returns:
        the timestamp

      • getCustomLocator

        public org.openqa.selenium.By getCustomLocator(java.lang.String locatorType,
                                      java.lang.String locatorValue)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method enables a By object to be created from a locator type and value.
        Parameters:
        locatorType - the locator type e.g. ID, CSS etc
        locatorValue - the locator value e.g. an XPath of CSS locator
        Returns:
        a By object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
